channel.title: Custom welcome screen?
channel.description:
I've added a custom welcome screen to my Windows XP computer, it works and all but one problem is that when my screen saver appears(I have password protect on resume checked) [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/dyng1w.jpg[/img] I also have the Welcome Screen checked [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/t65u9v.jpg[/img]
When my computer resumes from the screen saver it shows the classic logon screen
But when I click the WindowsKey + L to test it it shows the custom welcome screen and when I click Log off or switch user it shows the custom welcome screen, and when I first turn my computer on, so it's just the password resume.

item.title: Custom welcome screen?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

This doesnt look like Computer Hardware Discussion?

Id just do System Restore…

Read full topic

item.title: Custom welcome screen?
item.dc:creator: @DuhPk DuhPk
item.description:
@DuhPk wrote:

I’ve added a custom welcome screen to my Windows XP computer, it works and all but one problem is that when my screen saver appears(I have password protect on resume checked)

I also have the Welcome Screen checked

t65u9v.jpg735×531

When my computer resumes from the screen saver it shows the classic logon screen

But when I click the WindowsKey + L to test it it shows the custom welcome screen and when I click Log off or switch user it shows the custom welcome screen, and when I first turn my computer on, so it’s just the password resume.

Read full topic
